Example 1: "rawtext":[{"translate": "chat.type.announcement", "with": [ "value1", "value2" ]}]  Example 2: "rawtext":[{"translate": "chat.type.announcement", "with":{"rawtext":[{"text": "value1"}, {"text": "value2"}]}}]

en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.deleteRealmModalTex: Your Realm will be permanently deleted. You will not be able to access your world, your member list or the club.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.backupModalText: By replacing your realm with this backup, you will erase all recent progress from your Realm. The Realm will restart and all active players will need to reconnect.

en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.resetRealm: This will remove your current world from the slot and let you replace it with a new one. Your Realms members will have access to your new world. Select "Cancel" to go and download a copy of the current world to prevent data loss or "Confirm" to continue and replace your world.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.closeRealmMessage: Closing the realm will shut it down. Anyone currently playing on the realm will be disconnected. Are you sure you want to do this?
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.matchingPurchasePla: You purchased your subscription in the %s
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.nonMatchingPurchase: You started your subscription in the %s. You can only extend your subscription there.
You can manage your Realm subscription in the platform store where you originally purchased it.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.consumableToSubscri: You can't extend your Realm right now. We have now introduced subscriptions for Realms and you can buy a new subscription as soon as your Realm has expired in %d days. But don't worry! We will give you 14 extra days for free and your Realm will be kept online, so you will have plenty of time to extend it by then.

Your Realm has expired, but don't worry! We will keep it online for another %d days. You can now go ahead and extend it using the new auto-renewing subscription, so you don't have to worry about keeping your Realm up and running ever again.
Your Realm has expired. Go ahead and extend it using the new auto-renewing subscription, that way you don't have to worry about keeping your Realm up and running ever again.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.upload.worldtoobig: Upload failed. The world size exceeds the maximum uploadable limit of %s.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.download.worldtoobi: Download failed. The world size exceeds the maximum downloadable limit of %s.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.offerError.title: Purchase Pending
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.offerError.content: A purchase is already pending. You cannot make another purchase until it has been resolved. Please try again later.
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.dev_branch_label: Which commit should realm run on?
en_us.realmsSettingsScreen.uploadConfirmationM: This will remove your current world from your Realm's active slot and let you replace it with a new one. Your Realm's members will have access to your new world. Select "Cancel" to go and download a copy of the current world to prevent data loss or "Confirm" to continue and replace your world.
en_us.xbl.savePurchase.description.line1: Do you want to play with whatever you buy from any Minecraft Store enabled system? Sign in with a FREE Microsoft account and sync your purchased Skins, Textures, Maps, and Mash-ups to use and play in Minecraft!
en_us.xbl.savePurchase.description.line2: If you lose your system or uninstall Minecraft, your purchases will still be synced and accessible on any system when you use your Microsoft account.
en_us.xbl.savePurchase.title: Save purchases to a Microsoft Account?
en_us.xbl.savePurchase.toast.title: Success!
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.title: Sync purchases to your Microsoft Account?
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.description: Sign in to a Microsoft Account to sync your Skins, Texture Packs, Worlds, and Mash-ups. They will be there for you on any device where you play Minecraft.
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.toast.title: Success!
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.toast.message: Purchases synced to your Microsoft Account!
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.inProgress.message: Syncing purchases to your Microsoft Account…
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.skipSignIn.prompt.descriptio: This Microsoft Account will not be the primary account for this device if you do not sync this device's purchases to this account. You will not automatically sign in when you start Minecraft.
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.confirmSync.prompt.title: Sync to %s?
en_us.xbl.syncIAP.confirmSync.prompt.descripti: Would you like to sync your app store purchases to %s?
Packs purchased outside Minecraft Marketplace can only be synced once. They will continue to be available to anyone who plays on this device.
en_us.xbl.marketplace.account.error.body.nobut: There is an error with your account. You will be unable to use the marketplace until we have resolved the issue. If this issue persists for several days please contact support.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.title: You've been %s
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body: You have been %s from playing multiplayer in Minecraft. You won't be able to play on servers, join realms, host or join multiplayer games or use the marketplace.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body.line1: You have been %s from playing multiplayer in Minecraft due to "%s". You won't be able to play on servers, join realms, host or join multiplayer games or use the marketplace.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body.line2: Click '%s' below to view our community standards and how to submit a case review request if you feel you were %s in error.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body.line3.hour: You have 1 hour remaining on your suspension.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body.line3.hours: You have %d hours remaining on your suspension.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body.line3.day: You have 1 day remaining on your suspension.
en_us.playfab.account.banned.body.line3.days: You have %d days remaining on your suspension.
en_us.store.sign_in_warning.no_xbl_and_local_c: Important! You have purchased packs and/or Minecoins that are only available on this device and might be lost due to a device malfunction, loss, or uninstalling Minecraft! Sign in with a Microsoft Account (free) and transfer your pack entitlements and Minecoins to that account to protect and access your them on any device that you sign in on.
en_us.store.sign_in_warning.no_xbl_and_no_loca: Important! Purchased packs that are only available on this device can be lost due to device malfunction, loss or uninstalling Minecraft!
Sign in with a Microsoft Account (free) and transfer your pack entitlements to that account to protect your purchased packs and Minecoins.
In addition, you will be able to access them on any device you use to play Minecraft!
Content purchased through a partner store will be available as long as your device is signed in to your partner store account.
en_us.xbl.skipSignIn.prompt.title: Temporary Account
en_us.xbl.skipSignIn.prompt.description: This Microsoft Account will not be the primary account for this device if you do not transfer this device's purchases to this account. You will not automatically sign in when you start Minecraft.
en_us.xbl.signOut.title: Microsoft Account Purchases!
en_us.xbl.signOut.message1: While you are signed out of your Microsoft Account you will not have access to the Minecoins and items you bought in the store.
en_us.xbl.signOut.message2: Are you sure you want to do this?
en_us.dayOneExperience.carousel.title: Welcome to New Minecraft!
en_us.dayOneExperience.carousel.welcome_text: There's a lot of exciting new stuff in this new version of Minecraft! Check out the Marketplace, create a Realm, and play online with Cross-Platform friends!
en_us.dayOneExperience.carousel.marketplace: Minecraft Marketplace is a place to find new skins, worlds, textures, and mash-up packs by various talented creators.
en_us.dayOneExperience.carousel.cross_platform: Cross-platform play lets you connect with players on different platforms. Sign in to your Microsoft Account to play with all your Minecraft friends!
en_us.dayOneExperience.carousel.realms: Realms are servers run by us, just for you and your friends. Keep your Minecraft world online and always accessible, even when you log-off.
en_us.dayOneExperience.carousel.villager: New Minecraft is the only place to receive future updates containing new features, mobs, items, blocks and much more!
en_us.dayOneExperience.no_internet: Connect to the internet to load your previous skin.
en_us.dayOneExperience.intro_body_1: There's a lot of great new content in this update.
en_us.dayOneExperience.intro_body_2: Would you like help importing your saves, settings, and content from the previous version of Minecraft?
en_us.dayOneExperience.intro_welcome_1: You've updated to the latest version of Minecraft!
en_us.dayOneExperience.intro_welcome_2: If you would like to return to the previous version of Minecraft, you can find it on the main menu
en_us.dayOneExperience.editions_launch_warning: This is not the latest version of Minecraft, are you sure you want to launch the previous version of Minecraft?
en_us.dayOneExperience.settings_imported: We've imported your settings for you!
en_us.dayOneExperience.settings_skin_imported: We've imported your skin and settings for you!
en_us.dayOneExperience.skin_tip: You can change your skin by selecting the Profile button on the main menu.
en_us.dayOneExperience.skip_body: Old Worlds can be converted at any time from the Play Game - Worlds menu.
en_us.dayOneExperience.world_import_time: Tip: Conversion time will vary based on the size of the world.

en_us.gui.importRetailWorld.text.2: Importing the world creates a copy, and will not affect the original world.
en_us.gui.importRetailWorld.text.3: Would you like to make a Beta copy of this world?
en_us.gui.warning.exitGameWarning: Do you want to exit Minecraft?
en_us.gui.genericNetworkError: Something went wrong. Try checking your internet connection.

en_us.updateScreen.title: Version Out of Date
en_us.updateScreen.body: Update to the latest version to access all the new features, play with friends online, or see what's new in the Marketplace.
en_us.updateScreen.commerceNotSupported.title: Can't Access Marketplace
en_us.updateScreen.commerceNotSupported.body: This version of Minecraft can no longer access Minecraft Marketplace. Update to the latest version to restore Marketplace access.
en_us.updateScreen.packs.updateRequired: Please update to the latest version to download your pack purchased in Minecraft Marketplace.
en_us.howtoplay.adventureMode.title: How to Play : Adventure Mode
en_us.howtoplay.adventureMode.text.1: Adventure Mode is a gamemode for world builders. In Adventure Mode, players must use special tools to place or break blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.adventureMode.text.2: To get these special tools, you must use /give with canplace or candestroy parameters while in creative mode.
en_us.howtoplay.anvil.title: How to Play : Anvil
en_us.howtoplay.anvil.text.1: Experience Levels can be used to repair, enchant, or rename items with the Anvil.
en_us.howtoplay.anvil.text.2: All items can be renamed, although only items with durability can be repaired or enchanted with Books on the Anvil.
en_us.howtoplay.anvil.text.3: An item can be repaired by placing it in one of the input slots on the left, along with either some raw materials of the item, like Iron Ingots for an Iron Sword, or combined with another item of the same type.
en_us.howtoplay.anvil.text.4: Combining items is more efficient when done with an Anvil.
en_us.howtoplay.anvil.text.5: There is a chance that the Anvil will be damaged with each use and after enough usage it will be destroyed.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.title: How to Play : Armor
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.1: By wearing Armor, you can protect yourself from incoming damage. Your Armor level is represented by :armor: on the HUD, the higher the level, the less damage you will take.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.2: Armor can be crafted from Leather, Iron, Gold, or Diamond. Chain Armor can be obtained through villager trading and loot from zombies and skeletons.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.3: Equip Armor by opening your inventory and moving pieces of Armor to the appropriate slot next to your player skin.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.4: Iron, Chain, and Gold Armor can be smelted into Iron or Gold Nuggets in a Furnace.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.5.keyboard: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press and hold :_input_key.sneak: to block with the Shield.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.5.gamepad: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press the :_input_key.sneak: button or click :_gamepad_stick_right: to toggle block with the Shield.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.5.touch: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Tap :touch_sneak: to toggle block with the Shield.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.5.rift_controller: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press the :_input_key.sneak: button or click :rift_X: to toggle block with the Shield.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.5.windowsmr_control: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press the :_input_key.sneak: button or click :windowsmr_right_stick: to toggle block with the Shield.
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.6: The Shield can even block a Creeper explosion!
en_us.howtoplay.armor.text.7: You can also wear a Carved Pumpkin on your head. This won't give you any :armor: but will make it so Endermen won't get mad when you look at them.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.title: How to Play : Armor Stand
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.1: An Armor Stand holds your armor while you aren't using it.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.2.notTouch: Press :_input_key.use: on an Armor Stand while holding a piece of armor to place it on the Armor Stand.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.2.touch: Tap an Armor Stand while holding a piece of armor to place it on the Armor Stand.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.3.notTouch: Press :_input_key.use: on an Armor Stand with an open hand to remove something from the Armor Stand.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.3.touch: Tap an Armor Stand with an open hand to remove something from the Armor Stand.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.4.notTouch: An Armor Stand can change its pose, sneak and press :_input_key.use: on an Armor Stand to change the pose.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.4.touch: An Armor Stand can change its pose, sneak and tap an Armor Stand to change the pose.
en_us.howtoplay.armorStand.text.5: Armor Stands will react to a Redstone signal, try giving it different signal strengths and see what happens.
en_us.howtoplay.banners.title: How to Play : Banners
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.1: Banners are a cool way to decorate your house or castle with custom patterns and colors.
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.2: After crafting a Banner, you can put it on a Crafting Table or Loom and add different dyes to create your own unique, cool design!
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.3: There are many different patterns that you can create with your dye such as:
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.4: - Making a triangle will give you a chevron pattern.
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.5: - Making a cross gives you a cross pattern.
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.6: - Adding a Oxeye Daisy gives you a flower pattern.
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.7: Experiment with different combinations to get even more patterns!
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.8: A Banner can also have multiple layers, allowing you to have more than one pattern on your Banner. If you don't like the last pattern you put on a Banner, you can wash the last layer off in a Cauldron.
en_us.howtoplay.banners.text.9: If you want to copy a Banner, put it on the Crafting Table with a blank Banner.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.title: How to Play : Beacons
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.1: Active Beacons project a bright beam of light into the sky.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.2: They are crafted with Glass, Obsidian, and Nether Stars (which is obtained by defeating the Wither).
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.3: Beacons must be placed so that they have an unobstructed view of the sky and must be placed on Pyramids of Iron, Gold, Emerald, or Diamond blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.4: The material that the Beacon is placed on has no effect on the power of the Beacon.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.5: In the Beacon menu you can select one primary power for your Beacon. The more tiers your pyramid has the more powers you can have.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.6: To set the powers of your Beacon you must use an Emerald, Diamond, Gold Ingot, or Iron Ingot in the payment slot.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.7: Once set, the powers will emanate from the Beacon indefinitely. Powers are granted to all nearby players.
en_us.howtoplay.beacons.text.8: To change the color of the beam, place a stained glass block in its path.
en_us.howtoplay.beds.title: How to Play : Beds
en_us.howtoplay.beds.text.1: Sleeping in a Bed passes the night and sets your spawn point.
en_us.howtoplay.beds.text.2.notTouch: Press :_input_key.use: on a Bed to go to sleep. This can only be done at night.
en_us.howtoplay.beds.text.2.touch: Tap a Bed to go to sleep. This can only be done at night.
en_us.howtoplay.beds.text.3: If you are playing Multiplayer, everyone in the world must be in a Bed at the same time to pass the night.
en_us.howtoplay.beds.text.4: If your Bed is broken you will return to where you first spawned into the world.
en_us.howtoplay.beds.text.5: Be careful when using a Bed in the Nether, it's usually too hot to sleep.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.title: How to Play : Blocks
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.1: The world of Minecraft is made from millions of blocks. Each one is breakable, collectable, and placeable. There are almost no limits to what you can build!
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.2: Most blocks you will have to find in the world, but some can only be crafted such as combining other blocks on a crafting table like a Redstone Block or smelted in a furnace like Glass.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.3: Most blocks are not affected by gravity and can float in mid air, but some like Sand and Gravel, will fall if there is no block underneath them.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.4: Here are some examples of the more interesting blocks in Minecraft:
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.5: Glass - This is a transparent block that is made by smelting Sand in a Furnace.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.6: Concrete - This is made by dropping a Concrete Powder block into water.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.7: Terracotta - This is found naturally in Badlands biomes or can be crafted and dyed from Clay that is found underwater. Terracotta can be made into Glazed Terracotta by smelting it in a Furnace.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.8: Magma - This is found naturally in the Nether, it gives off a little light and will burn whoever steps on it.
en_us.howtoplay.blocks.text.9: Coarse Dirt - This is almost like a normal Dirt Block but Grass can't grow on it. It can be found in Savanna and Mega Taiga biomes.
en_us.howtoplay.bookAndQuill.title: How to Play : Book & Quill
en_us.howtoplay.bookAndQuill.text.1: The Book & Quill lets you record your adventures. Tell your story by entering text into the pages. You can even change the title and the author! Sign the Book & Quill to finalize your work. The Book & Quill will be editable until it is signed.
en_us.howtoplay.brewingStand.title: How to Play : Brewing Stand
en_us.howtoplay.brewingStand.text.1: Brewing potions requires a Brewing Stand. Every potion starts off with a bottle of water, which is made by filling a Glass Bottle with water from a Cauldron or water source.
en_us.howtoplay.brewingStand.text.2: A Brewing Stand has three slots for creating different potions. One ingredient can be used over all three bottles, so always brew three potions at the same time to best use your resources.
en_us.howtoplay.brewingStand.text.3: Putting Netherwart in the top position of the Brewing Stand will give you an Awkward Potion. This doesn't have any effect by itself, but creates a base potion that can be used to create more advanced potions.
en_us.howtoplay.brewingStand.text.4: There are many potion effects to discover, experiment with different ingredients and combinations to become a true alchemist.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.title: How to Play : Cauldron
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.1: The Cauldron is a container that can hold buckets or bottles of liquid.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.2.notTouch: Press :_input_key.use: on a Cauldron while holding a Bucket of Water or a Potion to fill the Cauldron with its contents.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.2.touch: Tap a Cauldron while holding a Bucket of Water or a Potion to fill the Cauldron with its contents.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.3: A Potion will only partially fill a Cauldron so you will have to use multiple Potions to fill it up completely.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.4.notTouch: Press :_input_key.use: on a Cauldron with your Arrow in hand to create all kinds of different arrows!
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.4.touch: Tap a Cauldron with your Arrow in hand to create all kinds of different arrows!
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.5.notTouch: To dye Leather Armor or Leather Horse Armor, press :_input_key.use: on a Cauldron filled with water while holding the desired dye. This will change the color of the water inside of the Cauldron. Then dip your armor into the Cauldron by pressing :_input_key.use: with armor in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.5.touch: To dye Leather Armor or Leather Horse Armor, tap a Cauldron filled with water while holding the desired dye. This will change the color of the water inside of the Cauldron. Then dip your armor into the Cauldron by tapping the Cauldron with the armor in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.cauldron.text.6: If you want to wash the dye off, dip the dyed item into a Cauldron of undyed Water.
en_us.howtoplay.chat.title: How to Play : Chat
en_us.howtoplay.chat.text.1.keyboard: Press :_input_key.chat: to open Chat. Type your message and press ENTER.
en_us.howtoplay.chat.text.1.gamepad: Press :_input_key.chat: to open Chat. Type your message and press the send button.
en_us.howtoplay.chat.text.1.touch: Tap the chat button to open Chat. Type your message and tap the send button.
en_us.howtoplay.chests.title: How to Play : Chests
en_us.howtoplay.chests.text.1.notTouch: Once you have crafted a Chest, you can place it in the world and then open it with :_input_key.use: to store items from your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.chests.text.1.touch: Once you have crafted a Chest, you can place it in the world and then tap to open it and store items from your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.chests.text.2: Items in the Chest will be stored there for you to put into your inventory later.
en_us.howtoplay.chests.text.3: Two Chests placed next to each other will be combined to form a Large Chest.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.title: How to Play : Command Blocks
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.1: Command Blocks are a powerful tool for map creators. They store and execute commands upon receiving a Redstone signal.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.2: To get a command block you must use /give.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.3: When a Command Block has either executed or failed to execute its stored command, it sends a Redstone signal from the side where the arrow is pointing.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.4: You can set the name of the Command Block in the Hover Note field.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5: Block Type - There are three types of Command Blocks, each with their own color and behavior:
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.1: - Impulse - Only executes the stored command when the block receives a redstone signal.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.2: - Chain - Executes the stored command when the Command Block behind it has or has not executed its command.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.3: - Repeat - Once activated, this Command Block will continue executing its stored command as long as it exists.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.6: Condition - There are two conditions, each will affect the behavior of the Command Block:
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.6.1: - Unconditional - Executes the stored command even if the Command Block behind it failed to execute its command.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.6.2: - Conditional - Only executes the stored command if the Command Block behind it succeeded in executing its command.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.7: Redstone - There are two redstone settings, each will affect the behavior of the Command Block:
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.7.1: - Needs Redstone - Requires a redstone signal to activate.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.7.2: - Always Active - Does not require a redstone signal to activate.
en_us.howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.8: A Command Block will also show you its previous output. This will help you figure out if a Command Block failed to execute its command and why.
en_us.howtoplay.commands.title: How to Play : Commands
en_us.howtoplay.commands.text.1: Commands can be executed from Chat. Type / before you type the command.
en_us.howtoplay.commands.text.2: There are multitudes of commands that will allow you to do amazing things. There are many sources out there that will provide you with all of the info that you'll ever need.
en_us.howtoplay.conduits.title: How to Play : Conduits
en_us.howtoplay.conduits.text.1: An active Conduit gives you powers when you are underwater.
en_us.howtoplay.conduits.text.2: A Conduit is crafted with Nautilus Shells and a Heart of the Sea. The Conduit draws power from Prismarine and Sea Lanterns.
en_us.howtoplay.conduits.text.3: Once activated, a Conduit will grant Conduit Power to anything nearby.
en_us.howtoplay.conduits.text.4: The more power it draws in, the further its abilities reach.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.title: How to Play : Controls
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.1: Minecraft is a game about placing blocks to build anything you can imagine. At night monsters come out, so make sure to build a shelter before that happens.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.2.keyboard: Use the mouse to look around.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.2.touch: Touch and drag along the screen to look around.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.5.keyboard: Press :_input_key.forward: twice in rapid succession or press :_input_key.sprint: to sprint. While you hold :_input_key.forward:, you will continue to sprint until you have less than :shank::shank::shank:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.5.gamepad: Push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward twice in rapid succession to sprint. While you hold :_gamepad_stick_left: forward, you will continue to sprint until you have less than :shank::shank::shank:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.5.touch: Press :touch_forward: twice in rapid succession to sprint. While you hold :touch_forward:, you will continue to sprint until you have less than :shank::shank::shank:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.5.rift_controlle: Push :rift_left_stick: forward twice in rapid succession to sprint. While you hold :rift_left_stick: forward, you will continue to sprint until you have less than :shank::shank::shank:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.5.windowsmr_cont: Push :windowsmr_left_stick: forward twice in rapid succession to sprint. While you hold :windowsmr_left_stick: forward, you will continue to sprint until you have less than :shank::shank::shank:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.6.notTouch: Hold :_input_key.attack: to mine and chop using your hand or whatever you are holding. You may need to craft a tool to mine some blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.6.touch: Touch and hold the screen on a block to mine and chop using your hand or whatever you are holding. You may need to craft a tool to mine some blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.7.keyboard: If you are holding an item in your hand, use :_input_key.use: to use that item or press :_input_key.drop: to drop it.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.7.gamepad: If you are holding an item in your hand, use :_input_key.use: to use that item or press :_input_key.drop: to drop it.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.7.rift_controlle: If you are holding an item in your hand, use :rift_right_grab: to use that item or press :rift_right_stick: to drop it.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.7.windowsmr_cont: If you are holding an item in your hand, use :windowsmr_left_trigger: to use that item or press :windowsmr_right_grab: to drop it.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.7.touch: If you are holding an item in your hand, touch the screen to use that item or touch and hold the item in your hotbar to drop it.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.8.keyboard: Sneaking is incredibly useful in Minecraft, sneaking keeps you from falling off of a block and hides your nametag. To sneak, hold :_input_key.sneak:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.8.gamepad: Sneaking is incredibly useful in Minecraft, sneaking keeps you from falling off of a block and hides your nametag. To toggle sneak, press :_input_key.sneak: or click :_gamepad_stick_right:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.8.touch: Sneaking is incredibly useful in Minecraft, sneaking keeps you from falling off of a block and hides your nametag. To toggle sneak, tap :touch_sneak:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.8.rift_controlle: Sneaking is incredibly useful in Minecraft, sneaking keeps you from falling off of a block and hides your nametag. To toggle sneak, press :rift_X:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.8.windowsmr_cont: Sneaking is incredibly useful in Minecraft, sneaking keeps you from falling off of a block and hides your nametag. To toggle sneak, press :windowsmr_right_stick:.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.swim.keyboard: Sprinting while in water will make you swim. Use the mouse to control the direction that you are swimming.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.swim.gamepad: Sprinting while in water will make you swim. Use the :_gamepad_stick_right: to control the direction that you are swimming.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.swim.touch: Sprinting while in water will make you swim. Touch and drag along the screen to control the direction that you are swimming.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.swim.rift_contro: Sprinting while in water will make you swim. Use the :rift_right_stick: to control the direction that you are swimming.
en_us.howtoplay.controls.text.swim.windowsmr_c: Sprinting while in water will make you swim. Use the :windowsmr_right_stick: to control the direction that you are swimming.
en_us.howtoplay.worldBuilder.title: How to Play : World Builder
en_us.howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.1: To place or use certain Minecraft: Education Edition blocks or items, a player must possess a special ability called 'World Builder'.
en_us.howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.2: With cheats activated, the host can enable or disable the World Builder ability for any players in the world.
en_us.howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.3: To grant World Builder ability to all players in the world, run the following command:
en_us.howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.5: To quickly toggle your own World Builder ability, run either of the following commands:
en_us.howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.8: To query your World Builder ability, run the following command:
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.title: How to Play : Permission Blocks
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.1: Minecraft: Education Edition features several special blocks that make it easier for teachers to create and employ lessons. Only players with World Builder ability can place and destroy these blocks. Only players without World Builder ability are subject to the restrictions imposed by these blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.2: Allow and Deny blocks control where players can build in a world.
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.3: Players can place or destroy blocks above Allow blocks. Players cannot place or destroy blocks above Deny blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.4: Allow and Deny blocks do not affect the area below them.
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.5: An Allow block with a Deny block somewhere below it prevents players from building in the space between the two blocks. Above the Allow block, players can place and destroy blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.6: Border blocks provide a force field that extends infinitely upward and downward, regardless of the presence of other blocks. Players cannot move through, over, or under a Border block. Players cannot place or destroy blocks that are above or below a Border block.
en_us.howtoplay.chalkboard.title: How to Play : Chalkboards
en_us.howtoplay.chalkboard.text.1: Chalkboards are used to display text in the world. Chalkboards display more text than Signs, can be edited after they have been placed, and come in three sizes: Slate, Poster, and Board. The lock toggle allows you to prevent non-World Builders from destroying or editing your chalkboards. Press :_input_key.use: on an existing chalkboard to edit it.
en_us.howtoplay.chalkboard.text.1.touch: Chalkboards are used to display text in the world. Chalkboards display more text than Signs, can be edited after they have been placed, and come in three sizes: Slate, Poster, and Board. The lock toggle allows you to prevent non-World Builders from destroying or editing your chalkboards. Tap an existing chalkboard to edit it.
en_us.howtoplay.chemistry.title: How to Play : Chemistry
en_us.howtoplay.chemistry.text.1: Students can simulate real world chemistry by using the Chemistry Equipment blocks. Build any of the 118 different elements by adjusting the sliders in the Element Constructor or view the composition of elements by placing them in the Element Constructor. Combine elements in the Compound Creator to produce chemical compounds. Put elements and compounds into the Lab Table to create Minecraft items. Reduce blocks to their component elements with the Material Reducer.
en_us.howtoplay.chemistry.text.2: Download the Chemistry Journal from the Minecraft: Education Edition website for a comprehensive guide to chemistry in Minecraft.
en_us.howtoplay.npc.title: How to Play : Non-Player Characters
en_us.howtoplay.npc.text.1: NPCs are non-player characters that can provide additional lesson information, hints, or instructions.
en_us.howtoplay.npc.text.2: Only World Builders can place, delete, name, or edit NPCs. NPCs can execute commands and link to websites. Commands can be assigned to buttons in the NPC's dialog window; website links will always have a button.
en_us.howtoplay.npc.text.3: NPCs have a variety of skins to choose from and are immobile.
en_us.howtoplay.camera.title: How to Play : Camera
en_us.howtoplay.camera.text.1: The Camera allows players to take pictures in the world.
en_us.howtoplay.camera.text.2: To take a picture from your point of view, press :_input_key.use:.
en_us.howtoplay.camera.text.2.touch: To take a picture from your point of view, tap and hold, then release.
en_us.howtoplay.camera.text.3: To take a selfie, place a camera and press :_input_key.use: on it.
en_us.howtoplay.camera.text.3.touch: To take a selfie, place a camera and tap the Take Picture button.
en_us.howtoplay.camera.text.4: Pictures can be viewed in the Portfolio or inserted into the Book & Quill.
en_us.howtoplay.portfolio.title: How to Play : Portfolio
en_us.howtoplay.portfolio.text.1: Pictures you have taken appear in the Portfolio. Press :_input_key.use: to view the Portfolio. When viewing the Portfolio, you can add captions to pictures, delete pictures, and export pictures as a series of images.
en_us.howtoplay.portfolio.text.1.touch: Pictures you have taken appear in the Portfolio. Tap and hold to view the Portfolio. When viewing the Portfolio, you can add captions to pictures, delete pictures, and export pictures as a series of images.
en_us.howtoplay.classroomMode.title: How to Play : Classroom Mode
en_us.howtoplay.classroomMode.text.1: Classroom Mode is an external application that provides educators with features designed to facilitate interaction with students. You can download Classroom Mode from the Minecraft: Education Edition website.
en_us.howtoplay.classroomMode.text.2: As the host of a world, use the command /classroommode to launch the Classroom Mode app and connect it to Minecraft: Education Edition.
en_us.howtoplay.codeBuilder.title: How to Play : Code Builder
en_us.howtoplay.codeBuilder.text.1: Code Builder allows players to explore, create, and play in Minecraft by writing code using familiar learn-to-code platforms.
en_us.howtoplay.codeBuilder.text.2: Launch Code Builder by pressing :_input_key.codeBuilder: or by using the command /code.
en_us.howtoplay.codeBuilder.text.2.touch: Launch Code Builder by tapping :code_builder_button: or by using the command /code.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.title: How to Play : Crafting
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.1.keyboard: Press :_input_key.inventory: to access the Recipe Book and Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.1.gamepad: Press :_input_container.crafting: to access the Recipe Book and Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.1.touch: Tap the Inventory Button to access the Recipe Book and Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.1.rift_controlle: Press :rift_B: to access the Recipe Book and Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.1.windowsmr_cont: Press :windowsmr_left_grab: to access the Recipe Book and Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.2: Arrange items from your Inventory or Hotbar in the crafting grid in the shape of an item recipe.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.3: If the recipe is correct the item you are attempting to craft will appear in the Output Slot to the right of the Crafting Grid. Take it from the Output Slot and put it in your Inventory. You can now use the item.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.4: There are many recipes and for some you will need a larger Crafting Grid than the 2x2 grid that you start with.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.5: Craft 4 Wooden Planks into a Crafting Table and place it in the world.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.6.keyboard: Press :_input_key.use: on a Crafting Table in the world to gain access to a 3x3 Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.6.gamepad: Press :_input_key.use: on a Crafting Table in the world to gain access to a 3x3 Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.6.rift_controlle: Press :rift_right_grab: on a Crafting Table in the world to gain access to a 3x3 Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.6.windowsmr_cont: Press :windowsmr_left_trigger: on a Crafting Table in the world to gain access to a 3x3 Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.6.touch: Tap on a Crafting Table in the world to gain access to a 3x3 Crafting Grid.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.7: On the left side of the screen you will see the Recipe Book, which is good if you don't know a recipe or want to quickly craft a recipe that you already know. You will also see the Crafting grid on the right side of the screen above your Inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.8.keyboard: Once you have found the recipe you want to craft, :_input_key.attack: the recipe to load it into the crafting grid, then take it from the Output Slot to the right of the Crafting Grid and put it in your Inventory. :_input_key.use: the recipe to auto-craft, this automatically crafts one set and puts it in your inventory. SHIFT + :_input_key.use: the recipe to auto-craft a whole stack.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.8.gamepad: Once you have found the recipe you want to craft, press :_gamepad_face_button_down: on the recipe to auto-craft, this automatically crafts one set and puts it in your inventory. Press :_gamepad_face_button_up: on the recipe to auto-craft a whole stack.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.8.touch: Once you have found the recipe you want to craft, tap the recipe to load it into the crafting grid, then tap the item in the output slot to craft it. Press and hold the item in the output slot to craft continuously.
en_us.howtoplay.crafting.text.9: When the :craftable_toggle_on: is on, the Recipe Book shows all of the recipes that you have ingredients for. When the :craftable_toggle_off: is off, the Recipe Book shows every recipe in the game, even if you can't craft it. Check the tabs or search if you are looking for something specific. In Creative Mode some recipes will be collapsed inside lists. Opening the list will expand it and show you all of the recipes inside.
en_us.howtoplay.craftingTable.title: How to Play : Crafting Table
en_us.howtoplay.craftingTable.text.1: The Crafting Table will let you craft more complicated recipes.
en_us.howtoplay.craftingTable.text.2.notTouch: Place it in the world, then press :_input_key.use: on the Crafting Table to use it.
en_us.howtoplay.craftingTable.text.2.touch: Place it in the world, then tap the Crafting Table to use it.
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.title: How to Play : Creative Mode
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.text.1: Creative Mode is there so you can build the land of your dreams mob free!
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.text.2: The creative mode interface allows any item in the game to be moved into the player's inventory without the need for mining or crafting the item. The items in the player's inventory will not be removed when they are placed or used in the world, and this allows the player to focus on building rather than resource gathering.
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.text.3: If you create, load, or save a world in Creative Mode, that world will have achievements and leaderboard updates disabled, even if it is then loaded in Survival Mode.
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4.keyboard: To fly when in Creative Mode, press :_input_key.jump: twice quickly. To exit flying, repeat the action. To fly faster, push :_input_key.forward: twice in rapid succession or press :_input_key.sprint: while flying. When in flying mode, you can hold down :_input_key.jump: to move up and :_input_key.sneak: to move down.
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4.gamepad: To fly when in Creative Mode, press :_input_key.jump: twice quickly. To exit flying, repeat the action. To fly faster, push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward twice in rapid succession while flying. When in flying mode, you can hold down :_input_key.jump: to move up and :_input_key.sneak: to move down.
en_us.howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4.touch: To fly when in Creative Mode, Tap :_input_key.jump: twice quickly. To exit flying, repeat the action. To fly faster, tap :_input_key.forward: twice in rapid succession while flying. When in flying mode, you can press :touch_fly_up: to move up and :touch_fly_down: to move down.
en_us.howtoplay.difficulty.title: How to Play : Difficulty
en_us.howtoplay.difficulty.text.1: Minecraft has varying levels of difficulty so you can tailor the game to your level.
en_us.howtoplay.difficulty.text.2: No hostile mobs will spawn except for shulkers and the Ender Dragon, but they won't do any damage to you.
en_us.howtoplay.difficulty.text.3: Hostile mobs spawn but deal less damage. Hunger bar depletes and drains health down to 5 hearts.
en_us.howtoplay.difficulty.text.4: Hostile mobs will do normal damage, and if your hunger level drops to zero your health will begin to drop, but you won't die.
en_us.howtoplay.difficulty.text.5: Hostile mobs will do more damage, zombies will break through doors, and if your hunger level drops to zero, your health will drop and you could die.
en_us.howtoplay.dispensers.title: How to Play : Dispensers
en_us.howtoplay.dispensers.text.1: Dispensers are used to shoot out items. You will need to power each Dispenser with a redstone signal (for example, with a lever) to trigger it.
en_us.howtoplay.dispensers.text.2.notTouch: To fill a Dispenser with items, press :_input_key.use: on the Dispenser, then move the items that you want to dispense from your inventory to the Dispenser.
en_us.howtoplay.dispensers.text.2.touch: To fill a Dispenser, tap the Dispenser, then move the items that you want to dispense from your inventory into the Dispenser.
en_us.howtoplay.dispensers.text.3: Whenever you power a Dispenser, an item will shoot out.
en_us.howtoplay.dispensers.text.4: Dispensers can also be used to place items as well, such as Pumpkins on Iron Golems and equipment on Armor Stands.
en_us.howtoplay.droppers.title: How to Play : Droppers
en_us.howtoplay.droppers.text.1.notTouch: When powered by Redstone, Droppers will drop a single random item contained within. Press :_input_key.use: on the Dropper to open it and then you can load it with items from your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.droppers.text.1.touch: When powered by Redstone, Droppers will drop a single random item contained within. Tap the Dropper to open it and then you can load the it with items from your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.droppers.text.2: If a Dropper is facing a Chest or another type of container, the item will be placed into that instead. Long chains of Droppers can be constructed to transport items over a distance.
en_us.howtoplay.dyes.title: How to Play : Dyes
en_us.howtoplay.dyes.text.1: Dye is used to change the color of many things in Minecraft.
en_us.howtoplay.dyes.text.2: Some dye materials are harder to find than others. While most Dyes can be crafted from flowers like Red Dye from a Poppy, some Dyes are found or created in more obscure ways such as:
en_us.howtoplay.dyes.text.6: -Green Dye must be smelted from Cactus
en_us.howtoplay.dyes.text.7: -Bonemeal can help grow plants and trees or be crafted into White Dye
en_us.howtoplay.dyes.text.8: -Collect Ink Sacs from Squids for Black Dye
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.title: How to Play : Elytra
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.1: Elytra are an item that can be equipped to allow gliding. Elytra are equipped in the chest armor slot.
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.2: Elytra cannot be crafted, but are found in Item Frames in rare End Ships, guarded by fearsome Shulkers.
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.3.notTouch: When equipped with Elytra, a player can press :_input_key.jump: while falling to start gliding. Note that you need to be quite high to really get the full effect!
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.3.touch: When equipped with Elytra, a player can tap :_input_key.jump: while falling to start gliding. Note that you need to be quite high to really get the full effect!
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.4: While gliding, you can steer by looking around. If you look downwards, you'll move faster - but you'll also hit the ground sooner. If you look upwards, you'll gain some height - but do it for too long and you'll stall, falling instead of rising!
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.5: As you fly, your Elytra will lose durability. You can repair them by combining them with some Phantom Membrane at an Anvil. If they break mid-flight you'll fall, so be careful!
en_us.howtoplay.elytra.text.6: Firework Rockets that have no effects can be used to extend Elytra flight. You will be damaged if you use a Firework Rocket that has effects to extend flight.
en_us.howtoplay.enchantingTable.title: How to Play : Enchanting Table
en_us.howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.1: The Experience Points collected by picking up Experience Orbs can be used to enchant Weapons, Armor, Tools, and Books.
en_us.howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.2: When an enchantable item is placed in the slot below the book in the Enchantment Table, the three buttons to the right of the slot will display some enchantments with their Experience Level cost and Lapis Lazuli cost.
en_us.howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.3: The actual enchantment applied is randomly selected based on the cost displayed.
en_us.howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.4: If the Enchantment Table is surrounded by Bookshelves (up to a maximum of 15), with a one block gap between the Bookshelf and the Enchantment Table, arcane glyphs will be seen going to the book on the Enchantment Table and the potency of the enchantments will be increased.
en_us.howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.5: Enchanted Books are used at the Anvil to apply enchantments to items. This gives you more control over which enchantments you would like on your items.
en_us.howtoplay.endCities.title: How to Play : End Cities
en_us.howtoplay.endCities.text.1: After killing the Ender Dragon, an End Gateway will appear. Throwing an Ender Pearl into the portal will teleport you to the outer islands.
en_us.howtoplay.endCities.text.2: This alien new landscape must hide something interesting, and maybe something to bring back with you.
en_us.howtoplay.enderChest.title: How to Play : Ender Chest
en_us.howtoplay.enderChest.text.1: All Ender Chests in a world are linked. Items placed into an Ender Chest are accessible in any other Ender Chest. However, the contents of the Ender Chests are specific for each player. This allows players to store items in any Ender Chest, and retrieve them from other Ender Chests in different positions in the world.
en_us.howtoplay.eyeOfEnder.title: How to Play : Eye Of Ender
en_us.howtoplay.eyeOfEnder.text.1: Eyes of Ender are mysteriously connected to the End and will behave strangely when used.
en_us.howtoplay.eyeOfEnder.text.2: Rumor has it that they can lead you to open another dimension.
en_us.howtoplay.farming.title: How to Play : Farming
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.1: There are a variety of different crops that you can farm in Minecraft. Farming, while challenging, can provide an infinite food source.
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.2: Crops require light, water, and farmland to grow. You need a hoe, a water source, and seeds to farm.
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.3: The Blocks next to the water need to be converted to farmland, do this with the hoe. Water will saturate up to four block away.
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.4: Now you can plant your seeds. Make sure your crops are protected as they can easily die from being trampled or lack of water or light.
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.5: Fences can help protect your crops from hungry rabbits or trampling toes!
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.6: When the crops are fully grown they change in appearance and can be harvested.
en_us.howtoplay.farming.text.7: Some plants like pumpkins and melons grow on stalks. Be careful not to harvest the stalks!
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.title: How to Play : Fireworks
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.1: Fireworks are a fun way to create your own unique celebration in Minecraft!
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.2: Fireworks have two components, the Firework Rocket and the Firework Star.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.3.notTouch: To use a Firework, press :_input_key.use: on a block to send the Firework shooting into the sky.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.3.touch: To use a Firework, tap on a block to send the Firework shooting into the sky.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.4: Fireworks have no effect other than shooting up into the air.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.5: Firework Stars can be added to during the crafting of the Firework Rocket to give it many different colors and effects.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6: Firework Stars are made from gunpowder and various other items.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.1: - Color - Adding dye of any color will make an explosion of that color.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.2: - Twinkle - Adding Glowstone Dust will make the explosion twinkle.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.3: - Creeper Shaped - Adding a Head will make a creeper pattern in the sky.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.4: - Burst - Adding a feather will give the explosion a burst effect.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.5: - Trail - Adding a Diamond will give the explosion trails.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.6: - Star Shaped - Adding a Gold Nugget will make a star pattern in the sky.
en_us.howtoplay.fireworks.text.7: Fireworks can be fired from a dispenser. This will shoot the Firework in the direction that the dispenser is facing.
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.title: How to Play : Fishing
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.text.1: Fishing must be done with a Fishing Rod and is an excellent way to catch some fish or other cool items from the sea!
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.text.2.notTouch: Aim at a block of water and press :_input_key.use: while holding a fishing rod to cast the lure into the water.
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.text.2.touch: Look at a block of water and tap the Fish button while holding a Fishing Rod to cast the lure into the water.
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.text.3: Wait until you start to see a trail of bubbles coming for the lure.
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.text.4.notTouch: When the bubbles touch the lure, it will bob up and down. Press :_input_key.use: to reel in the lure. Be careful not to let your fish get away!
en_us.howtoplay.fishing.text.4.touch: When the bubbles touch the lure, it will bob up and down. Tap the Fish button again to reel in the lure. Be careful not to let your fish get away!
en_us.howtoplay.furnace.title: How to Play : Furnace
en_us.howtoplay.furnace.text.1: A Furnace allows you to cook or smelt items. For example, you can smelt Iron Ore into Iron Ingots.
en_us.howtoplay.furnace.text.2.notTouch: Place the Furnace in the world and press :_input_key.use: to use it.
en_us.howtoplay.furnace.text.2.touch: Place the Furnace in the world and tap to use it.
en_us.howtoplay.furnace.text.3: You need to put some fuel into the bottom of the Furnace, and the item that you want smelted in the top. The Furnace will then fire up and start working. Lots of things can be used as fuel; try experimenting with anything burnable!
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.title: How to Play : Game Settings
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.1: When creating a world, you have many options. Below are the various settings that can be used to fine tune your experience. Don't worry if you didn't set them when you created the world, they can be changed at any time.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.2: -World Name: This is where you can name your world.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.3: -Default Game Mode: This is the gamemode that all new players to the world will start with. You can have players start in either survival or creative mode. Selecting creative mode will turn cheats on.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.4: -Difficulty: This setting affects how difficult the world will be. You can choose Peaceful, Easy, Normal, or Hard.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.5: -Starting Map: If this setting is turned on, every player will start with a map in their hotbar.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.6: -Bonus Chest: If this setting is turned on, there will be a chest with some starting loot near your initial spawn location.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7: -World Type: This setting controls the way the world is created. Select Infinite, Flat, or Old from the drop down menu to change the world type.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7.1: - Infinite worlds go on and on forever.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7.2: - Flat worlds do not have any hills or trees, just an infinite flat area to fill with your creations.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7.3: - Old worlds limited in size and height.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.8: -Seed: This is a unique number for the world. By entering a seed when you make a new world, you can control how it is created. You can also use a word or phrase for the seed and the game will convert it to a number for you.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.9: -Activate Cheats: This setting allows players to use commands. When a world is created with this setting on, all achievements are disabled.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.10: Below are gamerules, cheats must be turned on to use them:
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.11: -Always Day: Night will never fall when this setting is turned on.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.12: -Do Daylight Cycle: The time will not advance when this setting is turned off.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.13: -Keep Inventory: This setting allows players to keep their inventory when they die.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.14: -Mob Spawning: This prevents all mobs from spawning when this setting is off.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.15: -Mob Griefing: Prevents mobs from destroying the world.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.16: -Entities Drop Loot: Controls whether things like minecarts and armor stands will drop themselves when they are broken.
en_us.howtoplay.gameSettings.text.17: -Weather Cycle: The weather will not change when this setting is turned off.
en_us.howtoplay.hoppers.title: How to Play : Hoppers
en_us.howtoplay.hoppers.text.1: Hoppers are used to automatically move items. Hoppers can be attached to some other items like containers such as Chests or Jukeboxes.
en_us.howtoplay.hoppers.text.2: Hoppers will continuously remove items out of a container placed above them and move them into the container they are pointing to.
en_us.howtoplay.hoppers.text.3: To make a Hopper point to a particular block, place the Hopper against that block while sneaking.
en_us.howtoplay.hoppers.text.4: If a Hopper is powered by Redstone, it will become inactive and stop moving items.
en_us.howtoplay.hostAndPlayerOptions.title: How to Play : Host and Player Options
en_us.howtoplay.hostAndPlayerOptions.text.1.no: When playing with cheats on, host options will allow you to teleport yourself or friends, change the weather, set the time of day, and change the entry point or world spawn of your game. Once cheats have been enabled, you can find these options in the chat window by pressing the [/] button next to the chat bar.
en_us.howtoplay.hostAndPlayerOptions.text.1.to: When playing with cheats on, host options will allow you to teleport yourself or friends, change the weather, set the time of day, and change the entry point or world spawn of your game. Once cheats have been enabled, you can find these options in the chat window by tapping the chat button.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.title: How to Play : HUD
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.1: The HUD shows information about your status, your health, your remaining oxygen (when you are underwater), your hunger level, and your armor (if you are wearing any).
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.2: If you lose some health but have at least nine :shank:, your health will replenish. Eating food will replenish your :shank:.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.3.keyboard: Press and hold :_input_key.use: while holding a piece of food to eat it.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.3.gamepad: Press and hold :_input_key.use: while holding a piece of food to eat it.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.3.rift_controller: Press and hold :rift_right_grab: while holding a piece of food to eat it.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.3.windowsmr_controlle: Press and hold :windowsmr_left_trigger: while holding a piece of food to eat it.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.3.touch: Press and hold a piece of food to eat it.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.4: You must watch your hunger level while adventuring, your hunger level is represented on your HUD with :shank:. The hunger level decreases as you explore. Certain activities will decrease hunger level at a faster rate, such as sprinting. You can replenish your hunger level by eating food. Some foods are more nourishing than others and will fill up more :shank:. When you get your hunger level up to maximum, the last food you ate applies a saturation value. Saturation is a hidden number that gives you an extra bonus to your hunger level.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.5: The Experience Bar is also shown on the HUD. The number shows your current Experience Level, and the bar indicates how many Experience Points are required to increase your Experience Level.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.6: Experience Points are gained by collecting Experience Orbs. You can get Experience Orbs from activities such as killing mobs, mining certain blocks, and more! Don't leave any Experience Orbs behind, you're going to need them. Move near Experience Orbs to collect them.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.7.keyboard: The hotbar shows the items that are available to use. Scroll the mouse wheel to change the item in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.7.gamepad: The hotbar shows the items that are available to use. Use :_input_key.cycleItemLeft: and :_input_key.cycleItemRight: to change the item in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.7.touch: The hotbar shows the items that are available to use. Tap items in your hotbar to change the item in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.7.windowsmr_controlle: The hotbar shows the items that are available to use. Press :windowsmr_left_touchpad_horizontal: to change the item in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.HUD.text.7.rift_controller: The hotbar shows the items that are available to use. Press :rift_left_trigger: or :rift_left_grab: to change the item in your hand.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.title: How to Play : Inventory
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.1.touch: Tap the Inventory tab to view your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.2: This screen shows the items that are available for use in your hand, and all of the other items that you are carrying. Your armor is also shown here.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.3.keyboard: Use :mouse_left_button: to pick up the item that is under the cursor. If there is more than one item here this will pick them all up, or you can use :mouse_right_button: to pick up just half of them.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.3.gamepad: Use :_gamepad_face_button_down: to pick up the item that is under the cursor. If there is more than one item here this will pick them all up, or you can use :_gamepad_face_button_left: to pick up just half of them.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.3.touch: Tap to select an item. If there is more than one item here this will select them all.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.4.keyboard: You can place items down again by using :mouse_left_button:. With multiple items on the cursor, use :mouse_left_button: to place them all or :mouse_right_button: to place just one.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.4.gamepad: You can place items down again by using :_gamepad_face_button_down:. With multiple items on the cursor, use :_gamepad_face_button_down: to place them all or :_gamepad_face_button_left: to place just one.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.4.touch: Tap another place in the inventory to move the item.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.5.keyboard: If the item the cursor is over is armor, you can quick move it to the correct armor slot by pressing SHIFT+:mouse_left_button:.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.5.gamepad: If the item the cursor is over is armor, you can quick move it to the correct armor slot by pressing :_gamepad_face_button_up:.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.6.keyboard: To drop an item, pick up the item and put it down outside of the inventory window.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.6.gamepad: To drop an item, pick up the item and press :_gamepad_face_button_up:.
en_us.howtoplay.inventory.text.6.touch: To drop an item, tap the item and then tap outside of the inventory window.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.title: How to Play : Jukebox
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.1: The Jukebox will play Music Discs that you have found.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.2.notTouch: Press :_input_key.use: on a Jukebox with a Music Disc in your hand to play it. Press :_input_key.use: the Jukebox again to eject the Music Disc.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.2.touch: Tap a Jukebox with a Music Disc in your hand to play it. Tap the Jukebox again to eject the Music Disc.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.3: When a Jukebox is playing a Music Disc, it will power Redstone Dust.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.4: Try different Music Discs for a different power level.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.5: See what happens when you let it play to the end.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.6: A Hopper can put a Music Disc in for you, and take it out when it's done playing.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.7: There are a couple of Music Discs that can be found in Chests around the world.
en_us.howtoplay.jukebox.text.8: Others are more difficult to come by, Creepers secretly appreciate music.
en_us.howtoplay.loom.title: How to Play : Loom
en_us.howtoplay.loom.text.1: The Loom is a fast and efficient way to apply patterns to Banners. The Loom only uses one Dye to apply a pattern. It can also use Loom patterns to apply special patterns.
en_us.howtoplay.loom.text.2: By placing a Banner into the Loom's first slot, and any color dye into the second slot, patterns can be added to the Banner. Once a pattern is selected, take it from the output slot on the right and move it to your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.loom.text.3: A Banner can have multiple layers allowing you to experiment with many different banner possibilities. Up to 6 patterns can be applied to a Banner to create a unique design.
en_us.howtoplay.loom.text.4: Adding a Loom Pattern to the Loom's third slot will allow the crafting of special patterns like a creeper face or a flower pattern. You will not lose your Loom Patterns when you apply these patterns to your Banners.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.title: How to Play : Mounts
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.1: A player can ride any adult Horse, Donkey, or Mule. Only Horses can be armored.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.2: Mules and Donkeys may be equipped with saddlebags (for transporting items) by attaching a Chest. These saddlebags can then be accessed whilst riding or sneaking.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.3.notTouch: Horses, Donkeys, and Mules must be tamed before they can be used. A player can tame a horse by riding it and staying on while it tries to buck them off. Press :_input_key.use: with an empty hand to attempt to tame Horses, Donkeys, and Mules.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.3.touch: Horses, Donkeys, and Mules must be tamed before they can be used. A player can tame a horse by riding it and staying on while it tries to buck them off. Tap the Mount button that appears when near a horse  to attempt to tame Horses, Donkeys, and Mules.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.4: When Hearts appear around the horse, it has been tamed and will no longer attempt to throw the player off.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.5: To steer a horse, the player must equip it with a Saddle.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.6: Saddles can be bought from villagers, found inside Chests hidden in the world, or acquired by fishing. While riding a horse, open your inventory and put a saddle in the horse's saddle slot.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.7: Horses and Donkeys can be bred like other animals using Golden Apples or Golden Carrots.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.8: Foals will grow into adult horses over time, although feeding them Wheat or Hay will speed this up.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.9: Llamas are another ridable mob which can be tamed and used to transport large shipments of items.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.10: Llamas can be tamed the same as horses. However, even when tamed, the player can't control their movements when riding them.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.11: A lead can be attached to one, and when this happens, surrounding llamas (both tamed and un-tamed) will follow, making a caravan.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.12: Llamas can be equipped with chests, giving it 3-15 slots of inventory space depending on the strength of the Llama. They can also be equipped with carpets. Each carpet color yields a different pattern.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.13: Pigs can be ridden as well, although they won't go where you want without a little incentive.
en_us.howtoplay.mounts.text.14: Equip a pig with a Saddle and point a Carrot on a Stick in the direction you want to go.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.title: How to Play : Multiplayer
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.1: Minecraft is a multiplayer game by default.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.2.splitscreen: You can have local players join your game by connecting controllers and pressing any button on their controller at any point during the game.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.3: By default, all worlds start with multiplayer enabled. If you would like to make the world private, go to world settings and select the multiplayer option, then toggle multiplayer off.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.3.norealms: By default, all worlds start with multiplayer enabled. If you would like to make the world private, go to world settings and select the multiplayer option, then toggle multiplayer off.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.4: To join a multiplayer game, go to the friends tab. All joinable Realms, Friends, and LAN Games will be shown here. Pick a game and select it to join.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.4.norealms: To join a multiplayer game, go to the friends tab. All joinable Realms, Friends, and LAN Games will be shown here. Pick a game and select it to join.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.5: When you start or join an online game, it will be visible to people in your friends tab. Once your friends join, the game will now be visible to friends of these friends.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.6: Note: You must have an internet connection and be signed in to a Microsoft Account to play multiplayer.
en_us.howtoplay.multiplayer.text.7: If you would like to manage the permissions of individual players, player permissions makes it easy. Open the pause menu and on the right, you will see a list of players currently in the world. Select their permission icon to adjust that player's permissions.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.title: How to Play : Navigation
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.1: Navigation is an important skill that you will learn in Minecraft as it's not always easy to find your way home.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.2: First of all, there are some basic tools that you should know about.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.3: A Compass will point in the direction of the first place you spawned into the world, an easy way to find where you started.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.4: A Map lets you see the area you've explored. Put it in your offhand slot to use it like a mini-map. You can increase its size by adding more paper to the edges in a Crafting Table.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.5: A Locator Map will show you where you are and what direction you are facing in relation to the Locator Map's origin. It will also show you the location of other players in the same world.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.6: A Cartography Table can help you create, expand, copy and even name maps.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.7: Place paper into the first slot to craft a Map. If you add a compass into the second slot you can craft a Locator Map. Adding Paper or a blank Map will let you expand or copy your Map.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.8: Try to watch for landmarks as you explore. The more you play on a world, the more you will be able to remember where you are. Another good trick is to place Torches as you go so that you may find your way back home.
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.9: The sun can also tell you what direction you are facing. Remember: the sun rises in the east and sets in the west!
en_us.howtoplay.navigation.text.10: There are several places for you to explore. Find a village and look for a Cartographer. He will trade you Explorer Maps that will lead you to strange places very far away.
en_us.howtoplay.netherPortals.title: How to Play : Nether Portal
en_us.howtoplay.netherPortals.text.1: A Nether Portal allows you to travel to a different dimension.
en_us.howtoplay.netherPortals.text.2: If constructed correctly the Nether Portal can be lit and activated.
en_us.howtoplay.netherPortals.text.3: Examples of portal construction are shown here:
en_us.howtoplay.nightfall.title: How to Play : Nightfall
en_us.howtoplay.nightfall.text.1: In Minecraft, the sun rises and sets as you adventure in your world. As the sun sets, you must take precautions. There are many dangers at night!
en_us.howtoplay.nightfall.text.2: If you have not already, you will need a place to take shelter from the dark and what lurks within it. This can be as simple as a hole in the side of a hill or a small cabin in the forest.
en_us.howtoplay.nightfall.text.3: Be sure to block off all entrances, you may want to use a door so you can go in and out. If you have made a bed this is a good place to put it along with your Crafting Table and Furnace.
en_us.howtoplay.nightfall.text.4: Also be sure to light up the area with torches, it may save your life.
en_us.howtoplay.pets.title: How to Play : Pets
en_us.howtoplay.pets.text.1.notTouch: There are several mobs in Minecraft that you can tame and make your pet. Each can be tamed by giving them an item that they like. Once tamed you can have them stay by pressing :_input_key.use: while looking at them.
en_us.howtoplay.pets.text.1.touch: There are several mobs in Minecraft that you can tame and make your pet. Each can be tamed by giving them an item that they like. Once tamed you can have them stay by tapping the Sit Button.
en_us.howtoplay.pets.text.2: Wolves are a neutral mob that hunt in the colder climates. They will attack Rabbits, Skeletons, and Sheep but run away from Llamas. They won't attack you unless you provoke them. You can tame them by giving them Bones.
en_us.howtoplay.pets.text.3: Cats are a neutral mob that can be found in villages. They will attack Rabbits and Baby Turtles. They will also keep Phantoms and Creepers away. They will try to run from you so taming them can be tough. They like fish so give them Raw Cod or Salmon to tame them.
en_us.howtoplay.pets.text.4: Parrots are a passive mob that live in the Jungle. They will imitate any other mob in the area. Seeds are their favorite, give them a few to tame them. Parrots will also sit on your shoulder... Yes, you can have more than one up there.
en_us.howtoplay.raids.title: How to Play : Raids
en_us.howtoplay.raids.text.1: While exploring the world you may encounter a Pillager encampment or patrol. Pillagers are always looking for villages to raid. Taking their Banners will get their attention, and they may choose to attack a nearby village.
en_us.howtoplay.raids.text.2: Be sure to defend your village, the attack will stop if you defeat all the raiders.
en_us.howtoplay.raids.text.3: Villagers will most likely be very grateful that you have saved them from the raiders. Be sure to check back with them, you might get a good deal.
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.title: How to Play : Ranching
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.1: In Minecraft, you can have your own ranch filled with livestock! Ranching provides lots of resources such as wool, eggs, and raw meat.
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.2: In order to keep your livestock growing, you have to make baby animals. Adult animals must enter Love Mode for this to happen. Feed the animals their preferred food to get them to enter Love Mode.
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.3: When two like animals are nearby and in Love Mode, they will kiss for a moment and then a baby animal will appear! The baby animal will stay with their parents until they grow into an adult. After having a baby, adult animals must wait 5 minutes before entering Love Mode.
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.4: Cows, mooshrooms, and sheep all eat Wheat. Pigs can eat Carrots or Beetroot. Chickens love Seeds of any kinds. Rabbits will eat Carrots, Golden Carrots, or Dandelions. Ocelots enjoy Raw Cod or Salmon. Wolves like to eat any kind of meat.
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.5: Animals will follow you when you hold their desired food item. This will help you lead them to your ranch or another animal.
en_us.howtoplay.realms.title: How to Play : Realms
en_us.howtoplay.realms.text.1: Realms is an awesome place to host a multiplayer game that is always running. Even when you aren't playing, your Realm will be up and running for your friends to explore!
en_us.howtoplay.realms.text.2: To set up a Realm, select Create New from the Worlds tab. Then select the New Realm button, then the Create New World button. Here you can name your Realm, and set the number of players. Then you will be able to add friends to your Realm.
en_us.howtoplay.realms.text.3: Once you have a Realm created, select the Pencil button to change the Realm settings.
en_us.howtoplay.realms.text.4: Under the Game button, you can rename the Realm, set the difficulty and gamemode, turn on cheats, and download/upload the world.
en_us.howtoplay.realms.text.5: Under the Members button you can manage all of the friends you've invited to your Realm, add/remove members, and set their permissions.
en_us.howtoplay.realms.text.6: Under the Subscription button you can see when the Realm will expire, extend the time until expiration, and open/close the Realm.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.title: How to Play : Redstone
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.1: Redstone Dust comes from Redstone that transmits an electrical signal. When it has power it lights up and transmits its signal to other Redstone items that are next to it.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.2: In order for one of these items to be powered, it needs a power source such as a Lever, Button, or Pressure Plate. Experiment to find them all!
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.3: Place some Redstone Dust next to a power source and turn it on to power it.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.4: There are many items that use a Redstone signal to do something, such as a Hopper or a Piston.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.5: Redstone allows for endless possibilities! Try creating something useful for yourself like an automatic farm!
en_us.howtoplay.resourceAndBehaviorPacks.title: How to Play : Resource And Behavior Packs
You can change the way that Minecraft looks and behaves using Resource and Behavior Packs.
In the Settings Menu, choose a pack from the available packs list and select the plus sign next to it. Now your pack will apply its changes to the default Minecraft pack.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.title: How to Play : Scaffolding
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.keyboard: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :_input_key.jump:. If you want to travel downward you can press :_input_key.sneak:.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.gamepad: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing the :_input_key.jump: button. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold the :_input_key.sneak: button.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.touch: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing the :touch_jump: button. If you want to travel downward you can press the :touch_fly_down: button.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.rift_contro: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing the :rift_A: button. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold the :rift_X: button.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.windowsmr_c: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing the :windowsmr_right_touchpad: button. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold the :windowsmr_right_stick: button.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.2: Scaffolding needs support. You can only place so many scaffolding horizontally without touching a different block. When you attempt to place too many scaffolding blocks without proper support, it will fall.
